member.summary: Interface for a service that will find and replace tokens in a given text.

member.summary: Gets the value of a given token, or an empty string if the token doesn't exist.

member.returns: The value, or an empty string if token wasn't found.

member.summary: Parses a given text for all tokens and replaces them.

member.returns: The parsed text with all token replacements.

member.name: T:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Installation.JsProxyGenerator
member.summary: Generates a JavaScript proxy that can be used to communicate with the plugin's webapi controllres.
member.remarks: Overloaded methods not supported currently. Only get, post, put and delete verbs supported.

member.name: F:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Installation.JsProxyGenerator.plugin
member.summary: The alchemy plugin currently being used to generate the proxy for.

member.name: F:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Installation.JsProxyGenerator.sb
member.summary: The string builder used to create the javascript with.

member.summary: Generates proxies for the given plugin.
member.param: The plugin to generate proxies for.

member.summary: Generates the bottom of the javascript proxy.

member.summary: Generates the top of the javascript proxy.

member.summary: Gets the best verb for the js proxy to use. Prefers to use GET if available, then POST. Else uses Delete or Put.
member.returns: The best method verb to use for the js proxy.

The parameters on the controller's method we're proxying.
Whether or not verb is a post or put method.

member.name: M:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Plugins.Services.UserService.GetData(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a core service user data instance representing the currently logged in user. This object is cached so that subsequent calls to GetUser will not fetch from the core services (unless the reload parameter is set to true). If the client is impersonated as a different user, this method will impersonate as the logged in user to get the data, then change the impersonation back automatically.
member.param: Whether or not to get the user directly from core services or use the cached object if available.
member.returns: The currently logged in user data.

member.name: M:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Plugins.Services.UserService.GetName
member.summary: Gets the username of the currently logged in user.
member.returns: The username of the user, ie "DOMAIN\MyName".

member.name: M:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Plugins.Services.UserService.IsSystemAdministrator
member.summary: Gets whether or not the currently logged in user is a system administrator.

member.name: T:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Utilities.Impersonator
member.summary: Impersonation of a user. Allows to execute code under another user context. Please note that the account that instantiates the Impersonator class needs to have the 'Act as part of operating system' privilege set.
member.remarks:
This class is based on the information in the Microsoft knowledge base article http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;Q306158
Encapsulate an instance into a using-directive like e.g.:
... using ( new Impersonator( "myUsername", "myDomainname", "myPassword" ) ) { ... [code that executes under the new context] ... } ...
Please contact the author Uwe Keim (mailto:uwe.keim@zeta-software.de) for questions regarding this class.

member.name: M:Alchemy4Tridion.Core.Utilities.Impersonator.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Starts the impersonation with the given credentials. Please note that the account that instantiates the Impersonator class needs to have the 'Act as part of operating system' privilege set.
member.param: The name of the user to act as.
The domain name of the user to act as.
The password of the user to act as.

member.summary: The base Tridion registry key.
